modelCorrections.rawOutput:
Here's the corrected HTML based on the WCAG 2.1 violation description and the provided examples:

- Incorrect HTML: <a href="https://www.bigododge.com/new-dodge-chrysler-jeep-ram-greenville/index.htm" style="text-decoration-line: none;">
- Corrected HTML: <a href="https://www.bigododge.com/new-dodge-chrysler-jeep-ram-greenville/index.htm" style="text-decoration-line: none;" title="New Dodge Chrysler Jeep Ram Greenville">

Explanation:
To fix the accessibility issue, I added the `title` attribute to the anchor tag (`<a>`). The `title` attribute provides a text description of the link's purpose, which is accessible to screen readers. In this case, I used "New Dodge Chrysler Jeep Ram Greenville" as the title, assuming that it accurately describes the destination of the link. This ensures that users relying on assistive technologies can understand the purpose of the link even if there is no visible text within the anchor tag.
